awd_titl_txt: Workshop on Mechanisms for Tropospheric Effects of Solar    Variability and the Quasi-Biennial Oscillation
awd_abstract_narration: This grant will support a workshop entitled "Mechanisms for                                                                                                Tropospheric Effects of Solar Variability and the Quasi-Biennial                Oscillation" to be held on June 20,21, 1989 in Boulder, Colorado                preceding the annual CEDAR* meeting. The workshop objectives are                to search for and evaluate hypotheses for mechanisms that might                 account for the solar variability/quasi-biennial                                oscillation/weather correlation as first discussed by Labizke                   (Free University, W. Berlin) and Van Loon (NCAR).  This topic is                part of the CEDAR and STEP** initiatives.  The workshop format                  will have invited tutorials covering the possible range of topics               that will be important for understanding and evaluating possible                mechanisms and poster papers that will present recent data                      analysis and model results.  The outcome of the workshop will be                a narrowing of the most likely scenario for mechanisms and a set                of recommendations for future research.                                              * Coupled Energetics and Dynamics of Atmospheric Regions                        ** Solar Terrestrial Energy Program
org_div_long_name: Division of Atmospheric and Geospace Sciences

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: THE REGENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF COLORADO
